channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Global chip stocks from Nvidia to ASML fall on geopolitics, Trump comments
item.description: Global chip stocks fell sharply with ASML, Nvidia and TSMC hit amid reports of tighter export restrictions from the U.S. and comments from Donald Trump.

item.title: UK's Labour vows planning reform and clean energy transition as King's Speech reveals key policies
item.description: The U.K.'s new Labour government on Wednesday outlined a raft of proposed legislation, including the nationalization of rail operators.

item.title: Biden says he might quit presidential race if 'medical condition' emerged
item.description: Biden, 81, has come under increasing pressure from members of his own party to withdraw from the race following his disastrous debate with Trump, 78.

item.title: U.S. and Saudi Arabia sign agreement for joint space exploration and research
item.description: Saudi Arabia has been investing in research and partnerships in recent years with the aim of growing its capabilities in the space sector.

item.title: Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly shares slide on new obesity drug trial from Roche
item.description: Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly shares slid Wednesday on promising early-stage trial data from Roche's latest obesity drug candidate.

item.title: ASML bookings surge as AI chip demand boosts purchases of its critical semiconductor tools
item.description: ASML reported second-quarter earnings and sales that beat forecasts, as interest in AI chips drives up demand for the firm's semiconductor making equipment.

item.title: Trump says Taiwan should pay the U.S. for defense; shares of chip giant TSMC fall
item.description: Donald Trump said he thinks Taiwan should pay the U.S. for defense claiming the country "doesn't give us anything."

item.title: 'Luxury shame': China's rich shy away from flaunting their wealth amid economic jitters
item.description: China's rich are cautious about flaunting their wealth as the economy faces headwinds, putting the country's luxury market under pressure.

item.title: The next front in U.S.-China tech battle? Underwater cables that power the global internet
item.description: With tech tensions between the U.S. and China rising, vast networks of underwater cables are becoming a new source of strain in international relations.

item.title: Chaos at Copa America raises doubts over U.S. 2026 World Cup readiness
item.description: The U.S. is set to host 78 out of the 104 World Cup matches as a co-host of the tournament in 2026, alongside Canada and Mexico.

item.title: Wealth in Turkey grew the most in the world at 157% despite soaring inflation, according to ranking
item.description: For Turks who own assets like homes, wealth has grown as inflation pushes the costs of those assets up.

item.title: British pound breaches $1.30 for the first time in a year as Labour seen ushering in stability
item.description: Sterling has been supported the perceptions of political stability in the U.K., according to analysts.

item.title: UK inflation holds steady at Bank of England's 2% target, above expectations
item.description: The Office for National Statistics released inflation figures for June on Wednesday.

item.title: Adidas shares rise after hiking 2024 guidance
item.description: Shares in Adidas nudged higher on Wednesday after the company announced it would hike its full year 2024 earnings guidance.

item.title: HSBC appoints Georges Elhedery as group CEO starting Sept. 2
item.description: Elhedery, who is the current chief financial officer, will replace outgoing head Noel Quinn in September.

item.title: Labour's gains in London have private equity looking to exit — the country
item.description: The U.K.'s new Parliament is in session, and the Labour Party promising is aggressive changes to private equity.

item.title: IMF raises India's economic outlook, says global growth will remain lackluster
item.description: While the IMF takes a bullish stance toward China and India's economic outlook, the U.S. could see a slowdown in growth momentum.

item.title: A growing number of parents are refusing to give their children smartphones — and the movement is going global
item.description: Parents are concerned about giving children smartphones as more studies show that mental health issues in kids is linked to smartphone and social media use.

item.title: Gold eases after hitting fresh record
item.description: On Monday, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said the Fed won't wait for inflation to reach the central bank's 2% target before it begins cutting.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Dow jumps 700 points, gold hits record, HSBC new CEO
item.description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose more than 700 points to close at another record high as the bull run appeared to broaden.

item.title: ‘I see them the whole time’: The problem of fakes in the art market
item.description: Forged artworks don't often come to light because of the reputational risk to the galleries or auction houses involved, insiders say.

item.title: Don't use astrology to pick stocks, experts say: It's 'neither optimal nor ideal'
item.description: Stefaniya Nova is one of many other astrologists who are taking to TikTok to dole out their two cents on where to park your finances.

item.title: This 28-year-old raised $20 million for his mental health startup. His No. 1 advice? 'Be a bit delusional'
item.description: Theodoric Chew, 28, is the co-founder and CEO of mental health startup Intellect. The company has raised over $20 million since 2019.

item.title: Trump 2.0 could be bad news for global inflation, analysts say
item.description: A second Trump presidency could reignite global inflation as his America-first policies drive up costs across the world, analysts warned.

item.title: Money launderers are increasingly turning to crypto to conceal flow of funds, Chainalysis says
item.description: The report said these criminals are using crypto because crypto is "cross-border, virtually instant, and generally inexpensive to transact."

item.title: IMF upgrades UK growth forecast in another boost to new Labour government
item.description: The upgrades come after two years of stagnation, with the U.K. falling into a shallow recession in the second half of 2023.

item.title: House Democrats circulate letter urging DNC not to rush Biden nomination
item.description: President Biden has faced mounting pressure to drop out of the race after his debate flop against Donald Trump in June.

item.title: Trump says he would let Fed Chair Powell finish his term if he wins in November, Bloomberg reports
item.description: Former President Donald Trump told Bloomberg Businessweek that he would let Fed chief Jerome Powell complete his term if he wins in November.

item.title: Iran plot to kill Trump prompted Secret Service to boost protection before rally shooting
item.description: The Secret Service has faced criticism over the attempted assassination of Donald Trump by Thomas Crooks, weeks after learning of the Iran plot.

item.title: Amazon's deal with AI startup Adept faces FTC scrutiny
item.description: Regulators in the U.S. and abroad are increasingly zeroing in on tech companies' investments and partnerships with AI companies.
